article.description: Steve Smith scored 13 points in the final 6:20, including a go-ahead jumper with just over a minute to play to lead the San Antonio Spurs to a 93-90 victory over the Boston Celtics on Wednesday night.
article.headline: Spurs turn to Smith, turn out lights on Celtics

images.name: Duncan, Tim 020109 inline
images.caption: With 29 points, Tim Duncan led the Spurs in scoring for the 15th straight game.

article.linkText: Spurs' Smith scores 13 in last six minutes, short-circuits Celtics
article.story:
BOSTON (AP) -- The San Antonio Spurs counted on Steve Smith against Boston instead of their usual inside combination of Tim Duncan and David Robinson. Smith scored 13 points in the final 6:20, including a go-ahead jumper with just over a minute to play to lead the Spurs to a 93-90 victory over the Boston Celtics on Wednesday night. "Steve made some big shots for us down the stretch," Spurs guard Terry Porter said. "We've tried to be successful on the perimeter to balance out what David and Tim do on the inside." San Antonio needed Smith's clutch shooting to beat the Celtics for the eighth straight time. There were nine lead changes and five ties in a seesaw fourth quarter. "Jim O'Brien has done a heck of a lot better job with his team than I have with mine," Spurs coach Gregg Popovich said. "They're not just improved, it's ridiculous the steps they have taken." With 1:28 remaining, Kenny Anderson rebounded Antoine Walker's missed 3-pointer and hit a 10-foot jumper to give the Celtics a 90-89 lead. Smith then hit a fallaway jumper to give the Spurs the lead for good. Smith added two free throws with 14 second left for the final outcome. Paul Pierce and Walker each missed a pair of shots over the final minute. "You get so focused in on their big men," Pierce said. "Their perimeter players knock down shots, and leaving Smith open cost us the game." Pierce led the Celtics with 31 points, including 26 in the second half. Boston has lost six of nine. Duncan had 25 points and grabbed 12 rebounds for the Spurs and led them in scoring for the 15th consecutive game. The Spurs are 12-3 against teams in the Eastern Conference. Pierce capped off an 18-7 run for the Celtics during a five minute run late in the third quarter with a driving lay-up to tie the game at 67. Walker had 21 points, 12 rebounds and eight assists for the Celtics, but played through a twisted knee in the first half and is scheduled to have an MRI tomorrow. "We did the right things tonight to win the game," Walker said. "My knee is killing me right now, but hopefully it will be OK." Boston lost back-to-back games at home for the first time since Nov. 21-23, when they lost to Atlanta and Toronto. With the Celtics trailing 36-31, Walker scored 11 of his 17 first-half points, including three 3-pointers to tie the game at 42. The Spurs connected on 23 of 26 free throws in the first half and hit 33 overall. There was a 21 minute power-outage with 5:08 remaining in the third quarter with the Spurs ahead 65-59.

Game notes
Spurs forward Bruce Bowen left the game in the first quarter with a broken finger. ... Since 1976, the Celtics and Spurs have almost the same records. San Antonio is 1163-888 and Boston is 1165-887. ... The new Boston Red Sox ownership group, led by former Florida Marlins owner John Henry, attended the game. ... The Spurs' four-game road trip represents their longest, since playing three games away from home to open the season. San Antonio plays 13 of the next 19 on the road. ... The Celtics (20-14) are off to their best start since 1990-91 when they were 29-5.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
